event_data.continuation_prompt:
CYCLE 2 MISSION: Frontend UI Enhancement for New Version Status States

The backend version checker has been successfully updated to detect four distinct states (ahead, behind, diverged, up_to_date). The next cycle should focus on updating the frontend dashboard UI to properly display these new states with appropriate visual indicators.

Tasks for Cycle 2:

1. UPDATE dashboard_templates/main_bundled.html:
   - Locate the updateVersionIndicator() function
   - Add handling for 'ahead' status: Blue/info color, message shows 'Local Ahead (N commits)'
   - Add handling for 'diverged' status: Yellow/warning color, message shows divergence details
   - Ensure 'update_available' keeps red styling
   - Ensure 'up_to_date' keeps green styling

2. ADD CSS classes for new states:
   - .version-ahead { color: blue or info color }
   - .version-diverged { color: yellow/orange or warning color }

3. OPTIONAL ENHANCEMENT: Add tooltip or hover text explaining each state:
   - 'ahead': 'You have local commits not pushed to remote'
   - 'diverged': 'Your local repo has diverged from remote - consider merging or rebasing'
   - 'update_available': 'A newer version is available - consider pulling'

4. FUNCTIONAL TESTING:
   - Start the dashboard server
   - Test the version indicator displays correctly for each state
   - Verify the refresh button works
   - Take screenshots to verify UI changes

Files to modify:
- /home/vader/AI-AtlasForge/dashboard_templates/main_bundled.html (JavaScript updateVersionIndicator function and CSS)

Success criteria:
1. 'ahead' status displays in blue/info color (not red)
2. 'diverged' status displays in yellow/warning color
3. All status messages are human-readable
4. Existing 'up_to_date' and 'update_available' displays unchanged
5. Dashboard loads without JavaScript errors

cycle_report.summary: Successfully fixed the version checker to distinguish between local repos being AHEAD vs BEHIND remote. Previously, any commit mismatch triggered 'Update Required' warnings. Now the system correctly identifies: (1) AHEAD - local has unpushed commits, shows 'Local Ahead (N commits)' instead of false update warnings; (2) BEHIND - remote has new commits, correctly shows 'Update Available'; (3) DIVERGED - both local and remote have unique commits; (4) UP_TO_DATE - commits match. All success criteria met with 100% test pass rate across self-tests (7/7) and adversarial tests (13/13).
achievements: Updated _check_repo_version() to use ahead/behind analysis instead of simple commit comparison (lines 218-280)
Implemented four distinct status states: up_to_date, ahead, update_available, diverged
Status messages now include commit counts for clarity (e.g., 'Local Ahead (2 commits)')
Preserved all existing functionality: dev_mode bypass, offline handling, caching
100% adversarial test pass rate (13/13 tests including edge cases, property tests, and spec alignment)
Epistemic score of 1.0 (perfect) with rigorous testing methodology
